post_text:
*NOTICE*

THERE WILL BE A SPECIAL CALLED BOARD MEETING OF THE STONE COUNTY BOARD OF EDUCATION ON AUGUST 25, 2020 AT 6:00 P.M. THIS MEETING WILL TAKE PLACE AT STONE MIDDLE SCHOOL PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT CENTER, 532 E CENTRAL AVENUE, WIGGINS, MS.

THE MEETING WILL BE HELD FOR:
• Adranos Discussion
• Resolution GCRF
• MS. Equity In Distance Learning Act
• Consent Agenda
(a) ESSER Assurances and Budget Review
(b) Contract/agreement between Horizon Software & SCSD
(c) Contract/agreement between Gulf Coast Mental Health & SCSD
(d) Contract/agreement between MHG at Stone County & SCSD
• Policies
(a) Revisions for 1st reading- IJBD - Responsible Use of District Issued Technology, IJ-R- Internet/Acceptable Use Policy

post_text:
All Stone County Schools will have a district wide drive through on Friday, May 22, 2020 between the hours of 9:00 a.m-12:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.-6:00 p.m. School personnel at each campus will be distributing the following items on that day:
Kindergarten-11th Grade
• Summer Learning Plans
• Report Cards
• Personal Items
• Awards
• Yearbooks (If available)
Seniors
Stone High School Seniors will have a senior celebration on Friday, May 22, 2020 at 7:00 p.m. The event will begin at the SHS bus lanes. Each student will be limited to (1) vehicle and may include as many passengers as that vehicle can legally hold. This is intended as a celebration and is NOT THE GRADUATION CEREMONY. Graduation for the SHS Class of 2020 will happen on June 20, 2020 at a location to be announced later. The following items will be distributed to seniors during the Friday, May 22 event beginning at 7:00 p.m.:
• Transcripts
• Awards
• Caps/Gowns
• Cords

post_text: The Stone High School Class of 2020 will graduate on Saturday, June 20, 2020. The time, venue and graduation procedures will be announced at a later date. These decisions will be determined by the guidelines set forth by the Governor, the CDC and the MS Department of Education. Graduates will be allowed a maximum of four attendees for the ceremony. Tickets will be required upon entry. The Stone County School District and the Board of Education hopes to make this ceremony as traditional and memorable as possible for our students. Just like you, we would love to continue the same great traditions that have been a part of our Stone County history; however, the safety and well being of our students, parents and community must be top priority when making these decisions. Further information will be communicated via social media, school webpages, and phone calls. Your patience and cooperation with this process is greatly appreciated.

Tickets will be required upon entry. The Stone County School District and the Board of Education hopes to make this ceremony as traditional and memorable as possible for our students. Just like you, we would love to continue the same great traditions that have been a part of our Stone County history; however, the safety and well being of our students, parents and community must be top priority when making these decisions. post_text: The Stone County School District is working diligently to ensure that the Class of 2020 has a memorable graduation ceremony. We have been in contact with multiple venues and are awaiting availability and stipulations that will be enforced due to the COVID19 virus. It is a top priority to make every attempt to graduate this class as traditionally as possible. Hopefully, we will have definite information soon and pass this information on to the graduates and community. We look forward to this special day for the Class of 2020!!

post_text: Based on Governor Reeves announcement today, all schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We will continue to offer educational opportunities and to serve meals to students. As we learn more, we will do our best to keep you informed. Continue to stay safe and God bless.

post_text: The Stone County School District will pass out educational packets this Friday, April 3rd. We based this change on Governor Reeves decision to enforce the “Shelter in Place” mandate. We will continue serving meals at this time. The safety and well being of our students is our top priority.

post_text: The Chevron in Bond and the Magnolia Community Center have been added as locations for our book project. We will post our first questions on Thursday and can’t wait to see your responses written on your “Week One” yellow paper. Please make sure they are visible to anyone driving by. Who knows, if your answer is correct, maybe we will leave you a “happy”!

post_text: The Stone County School District is having a community book event! If you were unable to pick up the book “The Lemonade War” during packet pickup, we have made them available at the following locations (book boxes) throughout our community: In front of City Hall, Jessie Jaynes, Dominoes Pizza, Mchenry Library, Perkinston Post Office and across the road from the Sunflower Community Center. We will post more locations as they become available. PLEASE ONLY TAKE 1 BOOK PER HOUSEHOLD so that everyone may participate. Each book has directions on how to participate. We know you will love this family activity and expect some happiness to come your way!

post_text: Governor Reeves has announced that ALL public schools will remain closed until April 17, 2020. The Stone County School District is creating an action plan to meet the needs of our students and personnel. Stay tuned to our websites, social media and broadcast messaging for updates. These are unprecedented times but we know that the parents, students and community of Stone County will rise to the occasion and be successful in our efforts. Please be safe and may God bless you.

post_text: Governor Tate Reeves has declared a State of emergency for the state of Mississippi. All public schools will be closed March 16-20 per his recommendation. The Stone County School District is out for Spring Break during this time. All athletic/school events will be cancelled for these dates. Please practice safe hygiene procedures and social distancing to ensure the best results against this virus. Updates will be posted as they become available. Have a safe Spring Break.
